Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge correctly applied the residency requirements under s. 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant must accumulate 1,095 days of physical presence in Canada within 4 years preceding application
Applicant owned property in Canada and returned after absences
Citizenship Judge focused solely on physical presence
Decision_Outcome: Denial of citizenship application due to insufficient physical presence
Remedy_Requested: Appeal of the Citizenship Judge's decision
Court_Ruling: Appeal granted; case remanded for new determination
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship Judge failed to consider quality of connection and pre-existing residency
Grounds_for_Claim: Legal error in assessing residency by ignoring non-physical indicators of residence
Legal_Standard: Residency may be established through physical presence, quality of attachment, or centralized mode of living
Assessment_Factor: Physical presence, quality of connection to Canada, property ownership, pattern of return after travel
Procedural_Issue: Federal Court review of administrative decision
Review_Standard: Reasonableness or correctness (implied by court identifying legal error)
Evidence_Used: Evidence of property ownership, travel history, ties to Canada
Application_Basis: Failure to meet 1,095-day physical presence requirement as narrowly interpreted
Evidence_Assessed: Physical presence records, evidence of ongoing connections to Canada
Relief_Sought: Grant of citizenship or reassessment of application
Governing_Rule: Residency requires 1,095 days in Canada within 4 years, assessed holistically
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider evidence of quality of connection
Outcome: Appeal granted, case referred back for new assessment
Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of citizenship due to incomplete legal analysis
Cause_Description: Applicant's citizenship application was denied due to perceived failure to meet residency requirements
Evidence_Handling: Incomplete consideration of relevant evidence regarding residency
Evidence_Issues: Overemphasis on physical presence; disregard of other residency indicators
Residency_Compliance: Disputed â€“ applicant met qualitative but not strictly quantitative criteria
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient evaluation of non-physical residency factors
Decision_Rationale: Judge erred in law by failing to consider all aspects of residency
Decision_Making_Body: Citizenship Commission (via Citizenship Judge), reviewed by Federal Court
Evidentiary_Issues: Narrow interpretation of residency excluding relevant contextual evidence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Objective assessment of residency based on totality of circumstances
